use.flag: Xen event channel interface for Linux

pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Event channels are the Xen equivalent of interrupts, used to signal when data (or space) is available for processing. There are 2 distinct implementations:
1. a Xen shared-memory + hypercall protocol for kernelspace 2. a binding to a set of libxc functions which access /dev/xen/evtchn for userspace (see `xen-evtchn-unix` opam package).
